extraEnv.description: additional environment variables to be added to the pods
extraEnv.title: extraEnv

imagePullSecrets.description: If defined, uses a Secret to pull an image from a private Docker registry or repository.
imagePullSecrets.title: imagePullSecrets

podAnnotations.description: Annotations to be added to the frontend pods
podAnnotations.title: podAnnotations

resources.description: Resource limits and requests for the controller pods.
resources.title: resources

revisionHistoryLimit.description: The number of old ReplicaSets to retain
revisionHistoryLimit.title: revisionHistoryLimit

route.description:
BETA: Configure the gateway routes for the chart here.
More routes can be added by adding a dictionary key like the 'main' route.
Being BETA this can/will change in the future without notice, do not use unless you want to take that risk
[[ref]](https://gateway-api.sigs.k8s.io/references/spec/#gateway.networking.k8s.io%2fv1alpha2)

additionalRules.description: Additional custom rules that can be added to the route
additionalRules.title: additionalRules

apiVersion.description: Set the route apiVersion, e.g. gateway.networking.k8s.io/v1 or gateway.networking.k8s.io/v1alpha2
apiVersion.title: apiVersion

filters.description: Filters define the filters that are applied to requests that match this rule.
filters.title: filters

httpsRedirect.description: adds a filter for redirecting to https (HTTP 301 Moved Permanently). To redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS, you need to have a Gateway with both HTTP and HTTPS listeners. Matches and filters do not take effect if enabled. Ref. https://gateway-api.sigs.k8s.io/guides/http-redirect-rewrite/
httpsRedirect.title: httpsRedirect

kind.description:
Set the route kind
Valid options are GRPCRoute, HTTPRoute, TCPRoute, TLSRoute, UDPRoute
kind.title: kind

matches.description: define conditions used for matching the rule against incoming HTTP requests.
matches.title: matches

route.title: route

selectorLabels.description: Additional labels to add to the pod
selectorLabels.title: selectorLabels

port.description: Kubernetes port where service is exposed
port.title: port

annotations.description: Annotations to add to the service account
annotations.title: annotations

create.description: Specifies whether a service account should be created
create.title: create

name.description:
The name of the service account to use.
If not set and create is true, a name is generated using the fullname template
name.title: name

extraEnv.description: additional environment variables to be added to the pods
extraEnv.title: extraEnv

imagePullSecrets.description: If defined, uses a Secret to pull an image from a private Docker registry or repository.
imagePullSecrets.title: imagePullSecrets

podAnnotations.description: Annotations to be added to the frontend pods
podAnnotations.title: podAnnotations

resources.description: Resource limits and requests for the controller pods.
resources.title: resources

revisionHistoryLimit.description: The number of old ReplicaSets to retain
revisionHistoryLimit.title: revisionHistoryLimit

selectorLabels.description: Additional labels to add to the pod
selectorLabels.title: selectorLabels

annotations.description: Annotations to add to the service account
annotations.title: annotations

create.description: Specifies whether a service account should be created
create.title: create

name.description:
The name of the service account to use.
If not set and create is true, a name is generated using the fullname template
name.title: name

additionalApps.description: A comma separated list of additional django applications to add to the INSTALLED_APPS django setting
additionalApps.title: additionalApps

airtableImportSoftTimeLimit.description: The maximum amount of seconds an Airtable migration import job can run.
airtableImportSoftTimeLimit.title: airtableImportSoftTimeLimit

amountOfGunicornWorkers.description: The number of concurrent worker processes used by the Baserow backend gunicorn server to process incoming requests
amountOfGunicornWorkers.title: amountOfGunicornWorkers

accessKeyId.description: The access key for your AWS account. When set to anything other than empty will switch Baserow to use a S3 compatible bucket for storing user file uploads.
accessKeyId.title: accessKeyId

bucketName.description: Your Amazon Web Services storage bucket name.
bucketName.title: bucketName

existingSecret.description: Name of existing secret to use for AWS credentials like backend.config.aws.accessKeyId and backend.config.aws.secretAccessKey. Keys in secret should be called `access-key-id` and `secret-access-key`.
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

s3CustomDomain.description: Your custom domain where the files can be downloaded from.
s3CustomDomain.title: s3CustomDomain

s3EndpointUrl.description: Custom S3 URL to use when connecting to S3, including scheme.
s3EndpointUrl.title: s3EndpointUrl

s3RegionName.description: Name of the AWS S3 region to use (eg. eu-west-1)
s3RegionName.title: s3RegionName

secretAccessKey.description: The access secret key for your AWS account.
secretAccessKey.title: secretAccessKey

batchRowsSizeLimit.description: Controls how many rows can be created, deleted or updated at once using the batch endpoints.
batchRowsSizeLimit.title: batchRowsSizeLimit

amountOfWorkers.description: The number of concurrent celery worker processes used to process asynchronous tasks. If not set will default to the number of available cores. Each celery process uses memory, to reduce Baserow’s memory footprint consider setting and reducing this variable.
amountOfWorkers.title: amountOfWorkers

beatDebugLevel.description: The logging level for the celery beat service.
beatDebugLevel.title: beatDebugLevel

beatStartupDelay.description: The number of seconds the celery beat worker sleeps before starting up.
beatStartupDelay.title: beatStartupDelay

runMinimal.description: When BASEROW_AMOUNT_OF_WORKERS is 1 and this is set to a non empty value Baserow will not run the export-worker but instead run both the celery export and normal tasks on the normal celery worker. Set this to lower the memory usage of Baserow in expense of performance.
runMinimal.title: runMinimal

disableAnonymousPublicViewWsConnections.description: When sharing views publicly a websocket connection is opened to provide realtime updates to viewers of the public link. To disable this set any non empty value. When disabled publicly shared links will need to be refreshed to see any updates to the view.
disableAnonymousPublicViewWsConnections.title: disableAnonymousPublicViewWsConnections

disableModelCache.description: When set to any non empty value the model cache used to speed up Baserow will be disabled. Useful to enable when debugging Baserow errors if they are possibly caused by the model cache itself.
disableModelCache.title: disableModelCache

dontUpdateFormulasAfterMigration.description: Baserow’s formulas have an internal version number. When upgrading Baserow if the formula language has also changed then after the database migration has run Baserow will also automatically recalculate all formulas if they have a different version. Set this to any non empty value to disable this automatic update if you would prefer to run the update_formulas management command manually yourself. Formulas might break if you forget to do so after an upgrade of Baserow until and so it is recommended to leave this empty.
dontUpdateFormulasAfterMigration.title: dontUpdateFormulasAfterMigration

existingSecret.description: Name of existing secret to use for the email password. Key in secret should be called `email-password`.
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

fromEmail.description: The email address Baserow will send emails from.
fromEmail.title: fromEmail

smtp.description: If set to any non empty value then Baserow will start sending emails using the configuration options below. If not set then Baserow will not send emails and just log them to the Celery worker logs instead.
smtp.title: smtp

smtpHost.description: The host of the external SMTP server that Baserow should use to send emails.
smtpHost.title: smtpHost

smtpPassword.description: The password to authenticate to the smtp host when sending emails.
smtpPassword.title: smtpPassword

smtpPort.description: The port used to connect to the smtp host.
smtpPort.title: smtpPort

smtpUseTls.description: If set to any non empty value then Baserow will attempt to send emails using TLS.
smtpUseTls.title: smtpUseTls

smtpUser.description: The username to authenticate to the smtp host when sending emails.
smtpUser.title: smtpUser

enableSecureProxySslHeader.description: Set to any non-empty value to ensure Baserow generates https:// next links provided by paginated API endpoints. Baserow will still work correctly if not enabled, this is purely for giving the correct https url for clients of the API.
enableSecureProxySslHeader.title: enableSecureProxySslHeader

existingSecret.description: Name of existing secret to use for secret configuration values like backend.config.jwtSigningKey and backend.config.secretKey. Keys in secret should be called `jwt-signing-key` and `secret-key`.
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

fileUploadSizeLimit.description: The max file size in MB allowed to be uploaded by users into a Baserow File Field.
fileUploadSizeLimit.title: fileUploadSizeLimit

hoursUntilTrashPermanentlyDeleted.description: Items from the trash will be permanently deleted after this number of hours.
hoursUntilTrashPermanentlyDeleted.title: hoursUntilTrashPermanentlyDeleted

initialCreateSyncTableDataLimit.description: The maximum number of rows you can import in a synchronous way
initialCreateSyncTableDataLimit.title: initialCreateSyncTableDataLimit

initialTableDataLimit.description: The amount of rows that can be imported when creating a table. Defaults to empty which means unlimited rows.
initialTableDataLimit.title: initialTableDataLimit

cleanupIntervalMinutes.description: How often the job cleanup task will run.
cleanupIntervalMinutes.title: cleanupIntervalMinutes

expirationTimeLimit.description: How long before a Baserow job will be kept before being cleaned up.
expirationTimeLimit.title: expirationTimeLimit

softTimeLimit.description: The number of seconds a Baserow job can run before being terminated.
softTimeLimit.title: softTimeLimit

jwtSigningKey.description: The signing key that is used to sign the content of generated tokens. For HMAC signing, this should be a random string with at least as many bits of data as is required by the signing protocol. See https://django-rest-framework-simplejwt.readthedocs.io/en/latest/settings.html#signing-key for more details.
jwtSigningKey.title: jwtSigningKey

backendDebug.description: If set to “on” then will enable the non production safe debug mode for the Baserow django backend.
backendDebug.title: backendDebug

backendLogLevel.description: The default log level used by the backend, supports ERROR, WARNING, INFO, DEBUG, TRACE
backendLogLevel.title: backendLogLevel

databaseLogLevel.description: The default log level used for database related logs in the backend. Supports the same values as the normal log level. If you also enable BASEROW_BACKEND_DEBUG and set this to DEBUG you will be able to see all SQL queries in the backend logs.
databaseLogLevel.title: databaseLogLevel

maxFileImportErrorCount.description: The max number of per row errors than can occur in a file import before an overall failure is declared.
maxFileImportErrorCount.title: maxFileImportErrorCount

maxRowReportErrorCount.description: The maximum row error count tolerated before a file import fails. Before this max error count the import will continue and the non failing rows will be imported and after it, no rows are imported at all.
maxRowReportErrorCount.title: maxRowReportErrorCount

root.description: The folder in which the backend will store user uploaded files
root.title: root

url.description: The URL at which user uploaded media files will be made available
url.title: url

migrateOnStartup.description: If set to “true” when the Baserow backend service starts up it will automatically apply database migrations. Set to any other value to disable. If you disable this then you must remember to manually apply the database migrations when upgrading Baserow to a new version.
migrateOnStartup.title: migrateOnStartup

minutesUntilActionCleanedUp.description: How long before actions are cleaned up, actions are used to let you undo/redo so this is effectively the max length of time you can undo/redo can action.
minutesUntilActionCleanedUp.title: minutesUntilActionCleanedUp

postgresStartupCheckAttempts.description: When Baserow’s Backend service starts up it first checks to see if the postgres database is available.
postgresStartupCheckAttempts.title: postgresStartupCheckAttempts

rowPageSizeLimit.description: The maximum number of rows that can be requested at once.
rowPageSizeLimit.title: rowPageSizeLimit

secretKey.description: The Secret key used by Django for cryptographic signing such as generating secure password reset links and managing sessions. See https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.2/ref/settings/#std:setting-SECRET_KEY for more details.
secretKey.title: secretKey

snapshotExpirationTimeDays.description: Controls when snapshots expire, set in number of days. Expired snapshots will be automatically deleted.
snapshotExpirationTimeDays.title: snapshotExpirationTimeDays

syncTemplatesTimeLimit.description: The number of seconds before the background sync templates job will timeout if not yet completed.
syncTemplatesTimeLimit.title: syncTemplatesTimeLimit

accessTokenLifetimeMinutes.description: The number of minutes which specifies how long access tokens are valid. This will be converted in a timedelta value and added to the current UTC time during token generation to obtain the token’s default “exp” claim value.
accessTokenLifetimeMinutes.title: accessTokenLifetimeMinutes

refreshTokenLifetimeHours.description: The number of hours which specifies how long refresh tokens are valid. This will be converted in a timedelta value and added to the current UTC time during token generation to obtain the token’s default “exp” claim value.
refreshTokenLifetimeHours.title: refreshTokenLifetimeHours

triggerSyncTemplatesAfterMigration.description: If set to “true” when after a migration Baserow will automatically sync all builtin Baserow templates in the background. If you are using a postgres database which is constrained to fewer than 10000 rows then we recommend you disable this as the Baserow templates will go over that row limit. To disable this set to any other value than “true”
triggerSyncTemplatesAfterMigration.title: triggerSyncTemplatesAfterMigration

waitInsteadOf409ConflictError.description: When updating or creating various resources in Baserow if another concurrent operation is ongoing (like a snapshot, duplication, import etc) which would be affected by your modification a 409 HTTP error will be returned. If you instead would prefer Baserow to not return a 409 and just block waiting until the operation finishes and then to perform the requested operation set this flag to any non-empty value.
waitInsteadOf409ConflictError.title: waitInsteadOf409ConflictError

allowPrivateAddress.description: If set to any non empty value allows webhooks to access all addresses. Enabling this flag is a security risk as it will allow users to send webhook requests to internal addresses on your network. Instead consider using the three variables below first to allow access to only some internal network hostnames or IPs.
allowPrivateAddress.title: allowPrivateAddress

ipBlacklist.description: Disabled if backend.config.webhook.allowPrivateAddress is set. List of comma seperated IP addresses or ranges that webhooks will be denied from using after the URL has been resolved to an IP using DNS.
ipBlacklist.title: ipBlacklist

ipWhitelist.description: Disabled if backend.config.webhook.allowPrivateAddress is set. List of comma seperated IP addresses or ranges that webhooks will be allowed to use after the webhook URL has been resolved to an IP using DNS.
ipWhitelist.title: ipWhitelist

maxCallLogEntries.description: The maximum number of call log entries stored per webhook.
maxCallLogEntries.title: maxCallLogEntries

maxConsecutiveTriggerFailures.description: The number of consecutive trigger failures that can occur before a webhook is disabled.
maxConsecutiveTriggerFailures.title: maxConsecutiveTriggerFailures

maxPerTable.description: The max number of webhooks per Baserow table.
maxPerTable.title: maxPerTable

maxRetriesPerCall.description: The max number of retries per webhook call.
maxRetriesPerCall.title: maxRetriesPerCall

requestTimeoutSeconds.description: How long to wait on making the webhook request before timing out.
requestTimeoutSeconds.title: requestTimeoutSeconds

urlCheckTimeoutSecs.description: Disabled if backend.config.webhook.allowPrivateAddress is set. How long to wait before timing out and returning an error when checking if an url can be accessed for a webhook.
urlCheckTimeoutSecs.title: urlCheckTimeoutSecs

urlRegexBlacklist.description: Disabled if backend.config.webhook.allowPrivateAddress is set. List of comma seperated regexes used to validate user configured webhook URLs, will show the user an error if any regexes match their webhook URL and prevent it from running.
urlRegexBlacklist.title: urlRegexBlacklist

annotations.description: Additional annotations for the Ingress resource
annotations.title: annotations

className.description: IngressClass that will be be used to implement the Ingress
className.title: className

enabled.description: Enable ingress record generation for the backend
enabled.title: enabled

hostname.description:
cert-manager.io/cluster-issuer: cluster-issuer-name
kubernetes.io/ingress.class: nginx
kubernetes.io/tls-acme: "true"
The publicly reachable hostname for the backend
hostname.title: hostname

asgiPath.description: The path under witch the asgi backend should be reached
asgiPath.title: asgiPath

wsgiPath.description: The path under witch the wsgi backend should be reached
wsgiPath.title: wsgiPath

tls.description: An array with the tls configuration
tls.title: tls

accessModes.description: the desired access modes the volume should have.
accessModes.title: accessModes

annotations.description: Annotations to be added to the PersistentVolumeClaim
annotations.title: annotations

enabled.description: use a PVC to persist file uploads
enabled.title: enabled

resources.description: represents the minimum and maximum resources the volume should have.
resources.title: resources

storageClassName.description: Name of the StorageClass required by the claim.
storageClassName.title: storageClassName

extraEnv.description: additional environment variables to be added to the pods
extraEnv.title: extraEnv

imagePullSecrets.description: If defined, uses a Secret to pull an image from a private Docker registry or repository.
imagePullSecrets.title: imagePullSecrets

podAnnotations.description: Annotations to be added to the frontend pods
podAnnotations.title: podAnnotations

resources.title: resources

revisionHistoryLimit.title: revisionHistoryLimit

additionalRules.title: additionalRules

apiVersion.title: apiVersion

filters.description: Filters define the filters that are applied to requests that match this rule.
filters.title: filters

httpsRedirect.description: adds a filter for redirecting to https (HTTP 301 Moved Permanently). To redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS, you need to have a Gateway with both HTTP and HTTPS listeners. Matches and filters do not take effect if enabled. Ref. https://gateway-api.sigs.k8s.io/guides/http-redirect-rewrite/
httpsRedirect.title: httpsRedirect

kind.description:
Set the route kind
Valid options are GRPCRoute, HTTPRoute, TCPRoute, TLSRoute, UDPRoute

selectorLabels.title: selectorLabels

port.description: Kubernetes port where service is exposed
port.title: port

annotations.description: Annotations to add to the service account
annotations.title: annotations

create.description: Specifies whether a service account should be created
create.title: create

name.description:
The name of the service account to use.
If not set and create is true, a name is generated using the fullname template
name.title: name

config.description: General configuration shared between the frontend and backend

maxImportFileSizeMb.description: The maximum file size in mb you can import to create a new table. Default 512Mb.
maxImportFileSizeMb.title: maxImportFileSizeMb

maxSnapshotsPerGroup.description: Controls how many application snapshots can be created per group.
maxSnapshotsPerGroup.title: maxSnapshotsPerGroup

publicBackendUrl.description: The publicly accessible URL of the backend. Should include the port if non-standard.
publicBackendUrl.title: publicBackendUrl

publicFrontendUrl.description: The publicly accessible URL of the frontend. Should include the port if non-standard.
publicFrontendUrl.title: publicFrontendUrl

config.title: config

database.description: Name of the database to use
database.title: database

existingSecret.description: Name of existing secret to use for PostgreSQL credentials
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

userPasswordKey.description: Key in the secret containing the password
userPasswordKey.title: userPasswordKey

userUsernameKey.description: Key in the secret containing the username
userUsernameKey.title: userUsernameKey

username.description: Name of the user to use
username.title: username

port.description: Port used to connect to PostgreSQL database
port.title: port

enabled.description: if authentication should be used with external Redis™
enabled.title: enabled

existingSecret.description: Name of existing secret to use for Redis™ credentials
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

userPasswordKey.description: Key in the secret containing the password
userPasswordKey.title: userPasswordKey

port.description: Port used to connect to Redis
port.title: port

additionalModules.description: A list of file paths to Nuxt module.js files to load as additional Nuxt modules into Baserow on startup.
additionalModules.title: additionalModules

disableGoogleDocsFilePreview.description: Set to `true` or `1` to disable Google docs file preview.
disableGoogleDocsFilePreview.title: disableGoogleDocsFilePreview

disablePublicUrlCheck.description: When opening the Baserow login page a check is run to ensure the PUBLIC_BACKEND_URL/BASEROW_PUBLIC_URL variables are set correctly and your browser can correctly connect to the backend. If misconfigured an error is shown. If you wish to disable this check and warning set this to any non empty value.
disablePublicUrlCheck.title: disablePublicUrlCheck

downloadFileViaXhr.description: Set to `1` to force download links to download files via XHR query to bypass `Content-Disposition: inline` that can’t be overridden in another way. If your files are stored under another origin, you also must add CORS headers to your server.
downloadFileViaXhr.title: downloadFileViaXhr

extraEnv.description: additional environment variables to be added to the pods
extraEnv.title: extraEnv

imagePullSecrets.description: If defined, uses a Secret to pull an image from a private Docker registry or repository.
imagePullSecrets.title: imagePullSecrets

annotations.title: annotations

className.description: IngressClass that will be be used to implement the Ingress
className.title: className

enabled.title: enabled

cert-manager.io/cluster-issuer: cluster-issuer-name
kubernetes.io/ingress.class: nginx

The publicly reachable hostname for the frontend

The name of the service account to use.

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global
